source_sentence: 佛說聖莊嚴陀羅尼經卷下
translation: Foshuo shengzhuangyan tuoluoni jing, vol. 2

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝散大夫試鴻臚卿
translation: Tripiṭaka of the Western Translation of the Scriptures, Tathāgata, Minister of the Chaoshan dynasty

source_sentence: 傳法大師臣施護奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by imperial decree by the Minister of the Transmission of the Dharma, Shihu
It was then that Śakra Devānām-Indra addressed the lord.
He spoke from the perspective of adornment, saying.

source_sentence: 三野體難難左(引)度努[口*殺]穌(引)那帝(引)穌(引)那帝(引)帝(引)那帝(引)帝(引)那帝(引)努哩彌(二合引)酥彌(引)那摩彌(引)那彌(引)底隷彌隷摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合引)喃(引)洛乞叉(二合引)迦嚕(引)引扇(引)底娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃野(引)嚩切摩(引)滿鄧迦嚕彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時毘沙門天王。
translation: 三野體難難左(引)度努[口*殺]穌(引)那帝(引)穌(引)那帝(引)帝(引)那帝(引)帝(引)那帝(引)努哩彌(二合引)酥彌(引)那摩彌(引)那彌(引)底隷彌隷摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合引)喃(引)洛乞叉(二合引)迦嚕(引)引扇(引)底娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃野(引)嚩切摩(引)滿鄧迦嚕彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時毘沙門天王。
He spoke in his own adorned words.

source_sentence: 三野體難難尼(引)馱努史(引)迦儞愈(二合引)哆訖哩(二合)目枳(引)入嚩(二合)隷(引)那彌(引)尾賀隷娑(引)哩(引)娑哩嚩底扇(引)底娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合引)喃(引)左夜(引)嚩切摩(引)滿度(引)婆挽覩娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時持國天王。
translation: "When he spoke, the king of the gods Shivarman said, 'Sano teinananni (cited) dānusi (cited) kāyanigayo (cited) dakri (dichotomy), dogri (dichotomy), eyko (cited) ruta (cited) nami (cited) ohera (cited) sarṣapa (cited) sarṣapa (dichotomy),' and then the king of the gods Shivarman said.
He spoke his own adorned teaching, saying.

source_sentence: 三野體難馱哩(引)難馱哩(引)馱囉尼馱哩(引)阿左愈(二合)帝布嚕母嚕扇(引)底孕(二合)娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合)喃(引)左洛羼迦嚕(引)彌夜嚩切摩滿度(引)婆挽覩娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時增長天王。
translation: "When he taught this from the adorned Ming, the Sāṃnadhari(citation needed), Nandhari(citation needed), Dharānidhari(citation needed), Azagai(binary), Tib. Sumeru(citation needed), Dhiru(citation needed), Sattva(binary), and Sattva(binary), Māmā Saree(binary), Sattva(binary), and Zakra(citation needed), Kakra(citation needed), Mayiya(citation needed), Mandu(citation needed), and Vaibhātu(citation needed), the then-growth god king," he said.
He spoke in his own adorned words.

source_sentence: 三野體難暗拏哩(引)半多哩(引)迦囉(引)帝(引)迦囉半帝(引)迦囉嚕鼻(引)迦哩馱哩(引)迦曩迦鉢怛哩(二合引)嚕嚕彌乞叉(二合)乞叉(二合)彌(引)阿(引)乞叉(二合)彌(引)波乞叉(二合)扇(引)底孕(二合)娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合)喃(引)左洛乞叉(二合引)俱嚕夜(引)嚩切摩(引)滿鄧婆嚩覩娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時廣目天王。

He spoke in his own adorned words.

source_sentence: 三野體難摩惹羅惹羅惹惹摩羅地哩地哩迦哩迦哩三滿哆枳哩枳哩扇(引)底娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合引)喃(引)左夜(引)嚩切(引)麼滿鄧迦嚕(引)彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時妙月天子。
translation: 三野體難摩惹羅惹羅惹惹摩羅地哩地哩迦哩迦哩三滿哆枳哩枳哩扇(引)底娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合引)喃(引)左夜(引)嚩切(引)麼滿鄧迦嚕(引)彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時妙月天子。
He spoke from his own adornment, saying.

source_sentence: 三野體難唵(引)嚩(引)禰(引)尾摩隷(引)鉢囉(二合)婆(引)娑嚩(二合)哩(引)設多囉濕彌(二合引)娑賀娑囉(二合)[咑-丁+羅]濕彌(二合引)鉢囉(二合)底娑囉底娑嚩(二合)底娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃俱嚕摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合引)喃(引)夜嚩切摩(引)滿鄧迦嚕(引)彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時一切天眾異口同聲。
translation: "Sano tidan om (citation needed) va (citation needed) ethne (citation needed) oma (citation needed) pala (btn) pa (citation needed) sarva (btn) li (citation needed) Śatama (btn) sahā (btn) sarva (btn) [da - ding + lu] sarva (btn) pala (btn) ti sarva (btn) ti sarva (btn) ti sarva (btn) sthiram (tr.) nyagrodha (citation needed) sthiram (btn) sthiram (btn) sthiram (citation needed) nyagrodha (citation needed) mang dangalu (citation needed) sthiram (btn) sthiram (btn) h (citation needed) At the time, all the gods spoke with one voice.
They spoke in an ornate voice, saying.

source_sentence: 三野體難俱嚕俱嚕酥嚕酥嚕布嚕布嚕扇(引)底孕(二合)娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃俱嚕摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合)喃(引)左野(引)嚩切摩滿鄧迦嚕(引)彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時諸星宿天異口同聲。
translation: "When the gods of the constellations spoke with one voice, the Sano Tiyan kuru kuru kuru kuru kuru kuru kuru puru puru puru (cited) sarvarut (b) sattvat (b) sattvat (b) mam (cited) zono (cited) vaipulya (cited) mam (cited) sarvarut (b) sattvat (b) mam (cited) sattvat (b) hah (cited), the gods spoke with one voice.
They spoke with one voice, saying, "Zhuangyan ming!

source_sentence: 三野體難哆隷(引)哆摩隷(引)阿隷(引)那隷(引)阿(引)迦(引)舍尾摩隷(引)扇(引)底孕(二合)娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃迦嚕(引)彌摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合)喃(引)左野(引)嚩切摩(引)滿鄧迦嚕(引)彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時一切龍眾異口同聲。
translation: "When all the nāgas and gods spoke with one voice, the Sanoṭīnadatta (cited), the Dharma-paripūrṇa (cited), the Āparipūrṇa (cited), the Āparinagara (cited), the Āparinagara (cited), the Āparinagara (cited), the Śākya-nāga (cited), and the Śākya-nāga (cited), the Zauḍa (cited), the Vaipulya (cited), the Dundubhakuru (cited), and the Saṃsāra (cited), all the nāgas and gods spoke with one voice.
They spoke in an ornate manner.

source_sentence: 三野體難嚩隷摩隷阿左隷麼地(引)阿(引)戍麼地(引)布(引)計扇(引)底孕(二合)娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃俱嚕摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合)喃(引)左野(引)嚩切摩滿鄧迦嚕(引)彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時二十八大藥叉軍主眾。
translation: "When the 28 great commanders of the Yakṣa army spoke with one voice, they all spoke with one voice, saying, 'Adorned in the words of the Buddha,'
They spoke with one voice, saying, "Adorn the brightness!

source_sentence: 三野體難涅哩(二合)茶鉢底鉢底嚕嚕達囉達囉扇底孕(二合)娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃迦嚕(引)彌摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合)喃(引)左野(引)嚩切摩(引)滿鄧迦嚕(引)彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時畢隷多毘舍遮鳩槃茶等眾。
translation: "When the crowd of 28 great yakṣa generals spoke with one voice, they said, 'Samyakti nirgrantha (btn), pti pti pti rudra rudra rudra rasta rasta fandi ger (btn), sattaya (btn), sthavana rudra (btn), mimomo sattaya (btn), sattaya (btn), sthavana (btn), sthavana (btn), sthavana (btn), zoano (btn), sthavana (btn), man dun ka rudra (btn), misa sthavana (btn), and others.
They spoke with one voice, saying, "Adorn the luminosity!

source_sentence: 三野體難尾部底三挽哩哆(引)曩(引)尾部底扇底孕(二合)娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃摩摩薩哩嚩(二合引)薩怛嚩(二合引)喃(引)左野(引)嚩切摩滿鄧迦嚕(引)彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時布單曩羯吒布單曩眾。
translation: "Sano teinan weibuti sanbri do (citation needed) an (citation needed) weibuti fandi ger (dichotomy) sattaya (dichotomy) sattapa (dichotomy) sattapa (dichotomy) an (citation needed) zoano (citation needed) vaipulya dunga lu (citation needed) mi sattapa (dichotomy) he (citation needed) at the time, the congregation of Butananan, Kāṭṭṭapuṇḍa, and Butananan.
They spoke with one voice, saying, "Adorn the luminosity!

source_sentence: 三野體難波努彌(引)迦囉(引)帝(引)鳥馱野(二合)哆祖囉拏(二合)娑彌囉尼(引)醋半底扇底孕(二合)娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃迦嚕(引)彌摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合引)室左(二合)野(引)嚩切摩(引)滿鄧迦嚕(引)彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時一切末怛哩(二合)眾。
translation: "When all the mātṛgārī congregations of Tissa Nandanubanum (cited), Kālāday (cited), Kauṇḍinya (cited), Dzurāna (cited), Sthiramati (cited), Saṃdhara (cited), and Manthaniramati (cited) spoke with one voice to explain the ornamentation and clarification, they said.
They spoke with one voice, saying, "Adorn the luminosity!

source_sentence: 三野體難迦隷摩計(引)隷(引)哆哩(引)哆摩哩(引)扇(引)底孕(二合)娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃迦嚕(引)彌摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合引)喃(引)野(引)嚩切摩滿鄧迦嚕彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時四方四羅剎。
translation: 三野體難迦隷摩計(引)隷(引)哆哩(引)哆摩哩(引)扇(引)底孕(二合)娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃迦嚕(引)彌摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合引)喃(引)野(引)嚩切摩滿鄧迦嚕彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時四方四羅剎。
They spoke with one voice, saying, "Adorn the luminosity!

source_sentence: 三野體難阿儞(引)播(引)儞(引)佉濟(引)佉嚩濟(引)祛祛哩隷閉波哩賀(引)哩扇底娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃迦嚕(引)彌摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合引)喃(引)左野(引)嚩切摩(引)滿鄧迦嚕(引)彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時捺囉彌多羅剎女。
translation: 三野體難阿儞(引)播(引)儞(引)佉濟(引)佉嚩濟(引)祛祛哩隷閉波哩賀(引)哩扇底娑嚩(二合)悉怛也(三合)野喃迦嚕(引)彌摩摩薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合引)喃(引)左野(引)嚩切摩(引)滿鄧迦嚕(引)彌娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)爾時捺囉彌多羅剎女。
She spoke in an ornate manner, saying.

source_sentence: 三野體難那那哩(引)那哩(引)賀賀賀賀呬呬呬呬護護護護尸枳枳枳唧枳唧尾目契摩佉惹佉喫吒彌致桉吒桉吒吒囉吒吒訖囉(二合)摩惹俱儒俱儒努努努努嚕(二合)努嚕(二合)怛嚕(二合)切彌隷彌彌隷阿曩過過欠彌努努努底體底彌底儞體隷彌致唧底彌致隷致閉致閉怛哩(二合)閉怛哩(二合)尼努呬儞母呬儞羅呬(引)嚩呬(引)那姹閉(引)曳爾時娑婆世界主大梵天王。
translation: 三野體難那那哩(引)那哩(引)賀賀賀賀呬呬呬呬護護護護尸枳枳枳唧枳唧尾目契摩佉惹佉喫吒彌致桉吒桉吒吒囉吒吒訖囉(二合)摩惹俱儒俱儒努努努努嚕(二合)努嚕(二合)怛嚕(二合)切彌隷彌彌隷阿曩過過欠彌努努努底體底彌底儞體隷彌致唧底彌致隷致閉致閉怛哩(二合)閉怛哩(二合)尼努呬儞母呬儞羅呬(引)嚩呬(引)那姹閉(引)曳爾時娑婆世界主大梵天王。

source_sentence: 前白佛言世尊我等天眾龍眾夜叉眾。
translation: He said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān, we gods, dragons, and yakṣas are all here.

source_sentence: 乃至捺囉彌帝如是等眾。
translation: We gods, dragons, yakṣas, and even Ārāmaṇerīs, such as these.
At that point, we all appeared before the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 各說自明為欲擁護羅睺羅童子。
translation: Each explained that he wanted to protect Rāhula the boy.
They wanted to prevent all the evil spirits and gods from coming near and disturbing him.
They would come near and disturb him.
He'll attain peace by day and peace by night.
And at all times, he'll attain happiness in his abode.
Bhagavān, what we've said is self-evident.
Not only will we protect Rāhula the boy.

source_sentence: 亦與未來一切眾生而作擁護。
translation: We'll also give protection to all future sentient beings.
Bhagavān, if there are sentient beings.
They hear such explanations from us.
They must wholeheartedly remember and uphold them.

source_sentence: 當令彼等一切行不饒益種種之類或一由旬或二由旬或三四由旬乃至十由旬內。
translation: It will cause them to engage in all practices that don't benefit various types, whether for one, two, three, four, or even ten leagues.

source_sentence: 不敢侵近驚怖退散遠避而去。
translation: They won't dare to approach them, become frightened, retreat, or avoid them.
They can cause such things to cease within ten leagues.
All evil is extinguished, and disease and miasma don't develop.
Their swords and armies are poisonous, and they all avoid them.

source_sentence: 亦復不為一切天龍夜叉羅剎乾闥婆阿修羅迦樓羅緊曩羅摩睺羅伽等而為障礙。
translation: They also won't be an obstruction to all the gods, dragons, yakṣas, rājas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnara, and mahoragas.

source_sentence: 亦復不為一切部多非人之類而為障礙。
translation: Nor will they be an obstruction to all the ministries and non-humans.
Bhagavān, these are all such people.
If they are disobedient and don't conform, that group won't be allowed to reject and cause them to leave the clan.
They won't be allowed to reject them and cause them to leave their clan.
It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Ānanda and said.
"This is the king of the Brahmas who came before me.

source_sentence: 說是誠實之言我已證知。
translation: I've realized that he spoke these words honestly.

source_sentence: 阿難我所宣說大莊嚴陀羅尼。
translation: Ānanda, this is the great adorning dhāraṇī that I've taught.
It has great power and momentum to subdue evil.
There's benefit that I've explained before.
Ānanda, suppose there's another person.

source_sentence: 以彼一切人非人等邪明呪術。
translation: With those mistaken incantations, such as those of humans and non-humans, they want to bind sentient beings to them.

source_sentence: 欲於眾生執持繫縛種種惱亂。
translation: They want to bind sentient beings to various afflictions.
They may be on the ground or in the sky.

source_sentence: 或在山際或在山頂及一切處。
translation: It might be on the edge of a mountain or on a mountain peak or anywhere else.

source_sentence: 以我聖莊嚴陀羅尼威德力故悉皆破滅。
translation: They are all destroyed by the power of my noble adornment dhāraṇī.
They can't harm all sentient beings.
The Buddha then addressed Ānanda, saying.
"The Buddha is real, the Dharma is real, the saṃgha is real, and the gods are real.
'The Buddha is true, the Dharma is true, the saṃgha is true, and the sages are true.'
These five things cannot be disobeyed.

source_sentence: 阿難如我所說汝善受持。
translation: Ānanda, as I've said, you should well accept and maintain them.
Enable it to prevail in the world in the future.
It will be of great benefit to all sentient beings.'
After the Buddha spoke this sūtra, the Rāhula boy got to hear the Bhagavān's teaching.

source_sentence: 羅睺羅童子得聞世尊說大莊嚴陀羅尼。
translation: Rāhula the boy had heard the Bhagavān speak the Dhāraṇī of great adornment.
He inherited all the insights and embraced them.
He didn't part from this assembly and attained peace and happiness.
His mind was pleased and joyous, and he leaped for joy.
He bowed his head to the ground and saluted the Tathāgata's feet.
He returned to the king's palace with his attendants.
Maitreya, the bodhisattva Ānanda ...

source_sentence: 乃至天龍夜叉及一切人非人等。
translation: ...and even the gods, dragons, yakṣas, and all humans and nonhumans.

source_sentence: 聞佛所說歡喜信受禮佛而退。
translation: They rejoiced and believed what the Buddha taught, saluted him, and withdrew.

source_sentence: 佛說聖莊嚴陀羅尼卷下
translation: Second Foshuo shengzhuangyan tuoluoni roll
